channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street sign is falling down, 27th September
item.description:
The street sign is leaning down and falling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Henley Drive, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown bushes on river walk before metal bridge, 27th September
item.description:
Walking from the play area through the tree arch on to the river walk going along to the metal foot bridge on the right are bushes which are over grown and high and you can’t see who or whats coming around the corner so women don’t feel safe when walking their dogs . I wonder if the over grown bushes can all be cut back now to make this area safe on winter evenings

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers damaged around pyramid slide in play area, 27th September
item.description:
The pyramid slide was burnt and damaged over a year ago now and has since had barriers placed around the base which youths continually damage and it gets reported on here . I understand that we now have the insurance for the slide and so wondered when this slide is going to be repaired and the barriers removed. It looks an eyesore and needs to be used again it’s a danger with these loose metal barriers being damaged they can fall on a child .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Racist graffiti, 27th September
item.description:
There is racist graffiti on the wall that looks out to the river. The location of this is directly opposite 172 Rotherhithe street on the wall closest to river. On the other side of Cumberland wharf, the small park. The racist N word is written twice and a lot of rambling in purple. I tried to wipe it off. It is permanent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
